  • Method Details

    • decodeCertificateArray

      public static X509Certificate[] decodeCertificateArray(CBORArray array) throws IOException, GeneralSecurityException
      Decodes a certificate path from a CBOR array. Note that the array must only contain a list of X509 certificates in DER format, each encoded as a CBOR byte string. The certificates must be in ascending order with respect to parenthood. That is, the first certificate would typically be an end-entity certificate. See encodeCertificateArray(X509Certificate[]).
      Returns:
      Certificate path
      Throws:
      IOException
      GeneralSecurityException

    • encodeCertificateArray

      public static CBORArray encodeCertificateArray(X509Certificate[] certificatePath) throws IOException, GeneralSecurityException
      Encodes certificate path into a CBOR array. Note that the certificates must be in ascending order with respect to parenthood. That is, the first certificate would typically be an end-entity certificate. The CBOR array will after the conversion hold a list of DER-encoded certificates, each represented by a CBOR byte string. See decodeCertificateArray(CBORArray).
      Parameters:
      certificatePath - The certificate path to be converted to CBOR
      Returns:
      CBORArray
      Throws:
      IOException
      GeneralSecurityException

    • unwrapContainerMap

      public static CBORMap unwrapContainerMap(CBORObject container) throws IOException
      Unwraps a container map object.

      This method is intended for CBOR map objects that optionally are wrapped in a tag. This implementation accepts two variants of tags:

          nnn(CBOR map)
          nnn([CBOR text string, CBOR map])

      The purpose of the second construct is to provide a generic way of adding an object type identifier in the form of a URL to CBOR map objects. The CBOR tag (nnn) would in this case be constant. Example: 

           211(["https://example.com/myobject", {
       "amount": "145.00",
       "currency": "USD"
     }])

      Both wrapping methods are intrinsically supported by CBORValidator and CBORDecrypter.

      To enable the creation of wrapped data you must implement CBORSigner.Intercepter.wrap(CBORMap) and CBOREncrypter.Intercepter.wrap(CBORMap) for signatures and encryptions respectively.

      Parameters:
      container - A map optionally enclosed in a tag
      Returns:
      The map object without the tag
      Throws:
      IOException
